content.description: Beginner's TR to the right of Special K with TR anchors on top. Variations from 5.9-5.7 possible. Good spot for newbies to stone. Easy approach to anchors on top but beware of loose rocks up there. Please use your own gear to TR to save wear on the hardware.
content.location: To the climber's right of SK but before Pescadero.

content.description: Beginner's TR with new anchors to the climbers left of Special K. About 5.7 or so a little more technical and thin than SK with the crux possibly off the ground so keep a tight belay. Approach from above. Please use your own hardware for TRing.
content.location: Fun House, far left.

content.description: This first half of this route has longer runs between bolts than other ones on the Fun House, but every more challenging section is thoughtfully and safely protected. Very fun if you're comfortable at its grade.
content.protection: 6 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks.
content.location: Right of center on the Fun House, just left of a black streak.

content.description: Slabby route with some bulges to overcome and a undercling crux at the second clip.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor on the top of the cliff.
content.location: 1st bolted sport climb on the left

content.description: A worthy enterprise. Crimp, edge, and high step your way up the center of the slab.
content.location: This is at the separate slab past the far corner of the fun house wall. Keep walking uphill climbers right along the base.

content.description: Super thin technical slab. Harder than it looks. Start either halfway up the gully or add 15' of contrived thin slab by starting at the base of the gully. Would've been quite hard to let go and clip so it remains as a TR.
content.protection: Girth hitch the double trunk pine tree at the top of the slab. Set the sling at about head height to keep your rope out of the dirt and create a good angle for the TR.
content.location: Left of Romper Room.

content.description: Water polished slab with some thin sections near the 3rd and 4th bolt.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains. Easy to set TR.
content.location: Located between two dark water streaks. 2nd route from the left.

content.description: Another interesting moderate sport route with several cruxy sections.
content.location: Middle of the Fun House.

content.description: Work up and right into the first small bulge to find a crux that may be harder for short folks. Easy climbing leads to a small ledge. Pull the mantle and enjoy the head wall up through the second bulge to the anchors. Under the last bulge there is a fairly large keyed in rock that feels a bit loose. Its worth keeping an eye on.
content.protection: 8 bolts to links at this time
content.location: Farthest right route at the Funhouse wall

content.description: This route is being entered based on information from the "North Tahoe, A Rock Climber's Guide" book by Josh Horniak. "Climb up a slab, through a break, then continue up the wall above."
content.protection: "7 bolts to anchors with Mussy hooks."
content.location: "Begin from atop a boulder 12' right of Bozo."

climbs.name: The Fun House
climbs.fa: Jeff Bostrum, Mike Carville, Josh Horniak

content.description: A short and easy route on the Fun House.
content.location: Left of the vertical feature that acts as a local drainage for water running down the cliff.

content.description: Easy warm up VB route
content.location: Boulder that is in front of Fun House slabs.

content.description: Problem is on the side of the boulder opposite from the slabs. Â Tricky top-out.
content.location: Boulder in front of Fun House Slabs

content.description: Arete that is right of the V2 route
content.location: Boulder that is front of the Fun House slabs

content.description: This is a straightforward V0 warm up route
content.location: Boulder right in front of Fun House

content.description: Fun face climbing on varied holds. Climbs through a bulge down low.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Tallest part of the wall.

content.description: More fun house style climbing. Mostly cruzer 5.8 with a couple cruxy puzzles for the grade.
content.location: Left of Sasquachito and just right of the black streak.

climbs.name: Circus Tricks
climbs.fa: Jeff Bostrum, Mike Carville, Josh Horniak

content.description: A variety of positive features and slabby surfaces. Take the path of least resistance at the crux, or go directly up the bulge for a slightly more challenginging sequence.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Bolted anchors with rap rings.
content.location: 4th route from the left.

content.description: Lichen filled crack in center of the wall.
content.protection: pro to 3.5" no anchor on top.
content.location: Center of The Fun House between Krusty the Clown and Circus tricks.

content.description: Follow three bolts to a sloping ledge then sustained slab moves to the anchors.  Route diagonals slightly right.
content.protection: 7 bolts and Mussy hooks for an anchor.
content.location:
Second route right of vertical slash.

The only picnic-sized boulder at the immediate base of the wall marks the start.
